reason.tex: \begin{align} \ora{A}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3} \\ \ora{B}&=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3} \\ \end{align} \\ %text Note: The scalar (dot) product of any two vectors $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ that have an angle $\theta$ between them is $|\ora{a}||\ora{b}|\cos\theta$. % \begin{align} \ora{A}\cdot\ora{B}&=(\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3})\cdot(\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3}) \\ &={\bf a_1b_1(\hat i\cdot \hat i)}+a_1b_2(\hat i\cdot \hat j)+a_1b_3(\hat i\cdot\hat k) \\ &+\; a_2b_1(\hat j\cdot \hat i)+{\bf a_2b_2(\hat j\cdot \hat j)}+a_2b_3(\hat j\cdot\hat k) \\ &+\; a_3b_1(\hat k\cdot \hat i)+a_3b_2(\hat k\cdot \hat j)+{\bf a_3b_3(\hat k\cdot\hat k)} \end{align} \\ %text All terms, except those in bold, are $0$ since the dot product of mutually perpendicular vectors contains $\cos(\pi/2) = 0$. % \begin{align} \therefore (\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3})\cdot(\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3})=a_1a_2+b_1b_2+c_1_c2 \end{align}
